svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Global Hunger Index vs. GDP per capita, 2017
Global Hunger Index (GHI) vs. gross domestic product (GDP) per capita, measured in 2011 international-$. The GHI
score comprises of four key hunger indicators: prevalence of undernourishment in the total population; childhood
wasting; childhood stunting; and child mortality. This calculation results in GHI scores on a 100-point scale where 0 is
the best score (no hunger) and 100 the worst. A score >=50 is defined as 'extremely alarming'; 35-50 as 'alarming';
Source: Global Hunger Index - IFPRI (2018), World Bank
